fields.description:
hi There,

I have a over hundreds of filters in JIRA that are cloned to generate similar queries using a different customer. I need to share those with same JIRA group e.g. "managers". With current JIRA behavior, I need to individually click the three dots icon on the right and change the share permission on the pop up and wait for the page to refresh. It takes 10-15 seconds for each filter. It is very annoying. What if there is a Multi Edit option page for editing permissions, filter name etc.

Thank You,

Parminder Sandhu
fields.summary: Multi edit option page for filters e.g. sharing permission for filters with others, editing filter name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are situations where JIRA's Mail Handler can't create issues by Email, such as encoding issues. Currently, JIRA will repeatedly throw the same error in the logs until the message is removed or processed.

h3. Suggested Solution

We can reduce the length of the logs and by eliminating unnecessary logs by setting a limit for number of errors for each mail failed message.
fields.summary: Mail Handler To Ignore Certain Mails After It Has Failed X Number of Times To Create Issues
UPM failure exceptions need to be more clear

fields.description:
Hi, after the recent update on 28th April, we cannot export the issues to csv anymore.

Only shows html , xml and word import. We have setup a reporting tool based on the JIRA issues csv export. Now the csv export is no longer showing, any work around for activating the csv export again??. !export no csv.PNG!
fields.summary: Cannot Export Issues to CSV any more

fields.description:
In JIRA, it is not possible to import attachments via the *Issues > Import from CSV* option
 We have multiple pieces of JIRA Core documentation that do not specify this from a user level:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-861257331....|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-861257331.html]

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer]

We should update both of these as well as going back to old documentation in JIRA to note that you cannot import attachments from the *Issues > Import from CSV* option.
fields.summary: Update Documentation on Importing attachments at the user level

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After translating an issue type or changing an existing translation, the new translation is not displayed as expected

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Translate any issue type to be displayed differently
# Create a new issue
# Specify a project in which the issue type exists

h3. Expected Results

The new translation will be displayed

h3. Actual Results

The original text or earlier translation is displayed for the issue type that was just translated.

h3. Workaround

Restarting JIRA causes the new issue type to be displayed. 

h3. Notes 

Very similar to JRASERVER-64106.
fields.summary: Issue type translation does not take effect in Edit or Create screen

fields.description:
h3. "Ouch!" error occurs on preview of PDF Version 1.5 attachments
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.x, any browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue.
 # Attach a PDF document saved using PDF Version 1.5 standard.
 # In the attachments panel, select the PDF file.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment preview appears.
h3. Actual Results

Error is thrown: "Ouch! Something is wrong with this file."
h3. Workaround

Two workarounds are available:
# Save the PDF in a program capable of saving files as PDF Version 1.6 or higher and reattach the file.
# Right-click and save-as or middle mouse click the file to download it instead of previewing it, then open it in a program of your choice.

h3. Notes

Issue does not occur with PDF versions 1.6 or later.
fields.summary: "Ouch! Something is wrong with this file." when previewing PDF version 1.5

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently project administrators have been provided with the permissions to apply changes to project specific configurations, such as components, workflows etc.

In certain use cases, it should be possible to configure which administrative tasks are available to the project administrators, and which are not.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide configuration options for which project administrative tasks are available to project administrators and which are not
fields.summary: As an Administrator, I want to configure which administration tasks are available to project administrators

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Due the recent changes mentioned in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65120, user's migrating from Cloud to Server will not be able to use the same credential and required to update their password before being able to login.
h3. Suggested Solution

 

Update the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-861253108.html] documentation to include the credential reset information so customers can make this change during migration.
h3. Workaround 

The administrator can either:

 
 # Request all their users to click on forgot password option and updating their credentials. or
 # Login using "sysadmin" username and reset all user's credential
fields.summary: Cloud to Server migration login related documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When pressing on the Comment button, if you click the 'Text' option first, the 'Text' and 'Visual' options become greyed out and you can no longer switch between them.
h3. Environment

Able to reproduce on https://jira.atlassian.com and JIRA 7.3.5
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Open up any Issue
 # Make sure the 'Text' tab is the option style selected.
 # Reload the page.
 # Press on the Comment button
 # Click the 'Text' option in the Rich Text Editor first.

h3. Expected results

You can access the Text style of the Editor just fine.
h3. Actual Results

The option becomes greyed out for both the Visual and Text editor and you can no longer switch between the two.

 

!Screen Shot 2017-05-01 at 9.25.29 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Reload the page or click on the Visual editor first and toggling between the editors back and forth will work just fine.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor 'Text' editor will become greyed out if clicked on first when clicking on the Comment button

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user adds an image as an avatar for a project, the image is not added to the list of available avatars the next time he wants to update the avatar of a project.

h5. Expected Behavior

When the user attempts to update the avatar, if they have used an image before, the avatar should be available for selection.

h5. Actual Behavior

The avatar would not be available and the user would need to upload the image again.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Add Image to Default Avatar List

	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.authenticateUser(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:311) [crowd-core-2.10.2-rc04.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.authenticateUser(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:198) [crowd-core-2.10.2-rc04.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(CrowdServiceImpl.java:75) [embedded-crowd-core-2.10.2-rc04.jar:?]

{noformat}

h3. Environment
* Delegated user directory with "Copy User on Login" checked and "Update User attributes on Login" unchecked

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Delegated user directory (Internal with LDAP Authentication)
# Check the "Copy User on Login" option
# Leave the "Update User attributes on Login" option unchecked
# Login with an LDAP user
# Rename the user on LDAP
# Login with the renamed user

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should create a new user for the renamed LDAP user

h3. Actual Results
JIRA throws the error 500 above on screen

h3. Workaround
We have 2 options
# Manually rename the user in JIRA
# Check the "Update User attributes on Login" option

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If an Admin of a JIRA instance uses External System import to add issues accidentally to an archived project(or even intentionally), the issues would be created since this is considered an import rather than a creation and JIRA is designed to accept it since you do not require a project permission for the External System Import process.

h5. Clarification

Can a section be added to the [Online Archive page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/archiving-a-project-802592917.html] adding a disclaimer clarifying the above scenario and stating clearly that the external system import would import issues irrespective of project permission?

Also, can we have a much clearer classification and disclaimer added to the [external system import CSV page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-data-from-csv-802592885.html] explaining that it is different from [Bulk Create Issue from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html] so that users are aware of the difference because it is not that clearly stated and can lead to confusion to some users.
fields.summary: Import  vs Bulk Create clarification in Archive Documentation

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When a user accesses their Dashboard via Dashboard.jspa after login, it is not recorded in the {{userhistoryitem}} table.
h4. How to reproduce
 # Create a new blank Dashboard in JIRA
 # Log out of JIRA
 # Log into JIRA
 # Run {{select * FROM userhistoryitem order by lastviewed desc}} and there is no row recorded for {{entitytype='Dashboard'}} for that user.

h4. Expected Result

An entry should be logged in the database for each and every Dashboard.jspa access.
h4. Actual Result

There is no entry logged in the database for the Dashboard.jspa access.
h4. Workaround

Enable *the HTTP access log* under Logging and Profiling. This data however is only available in the {{$JIRA_HOME/log/atlassian-jira-http-access.log}} and not in the database.
fields.summary: JIRA does not always log Dashboard.jspa to userhistoryitem table

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When a user logs out of JIRA, it is not recorded in the database.

h4. How to reproduce

Log out of JIRA and there is no record in the database.

h4. Expected Result

An entry should be logged in the database.

h4. Actual Result

It appears that browser cookie session is invalidated upon logout and no database rows are created/updated.

h4. Workaround

Enable *the HTTP access log* under Logging and Profiling. This data however is only available in the {{$JIRA_HOME/log/atlassian-jira-http-access.log}} and not in the database.
fields.summary: Record user logout time in the JIRA database

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Data Center's Heartbeat jobs can be delayed due to busy Caesium threads (timed operations) causing failure in an instance's heartbeat jobs. This can cause cluster nodes to be inconsistent for longer than normal because sync jobs cannot proceed until the Caesium queue is cleared.

Instance Health Checks show two failed checks:
 * Cluster Cache Replication
 * Shared Home

The observed cases have involved Caesium threads busy processing incoming mail handlers. It could be any other long running scheduled task (Directory sync, Email sending, etc)

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Mail handler to process an inbox with a very large number of emails (thousands).
 # Leave JIRA Data Center running for 10-15 minutes after restart

h3. Expected Results
Heartbeat job are not blocked/delayed by other long running scheduled jobs.

h3. Actual Results
Heartbeat job doesn't run and that cause the Cluster keep-alive timeout (and nodes marked offline). That leads to cache replications stop working. Health checks will throw an error on Cache replication between nodes and communication to Shared Home directory.

Thread dumps show all 4 Caesium threads are busy handling emails. Example thread:
{noformat}
"Caesium-1-1" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00000000000000a3 nid=0 runnable 
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	- locked <0x0000000032c2276e> (a java.lang.Object)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readDataRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:930)
...
	at com.sun.mail.iap.ResponseInputStream.readResponse(ResponseInputStream.java:103)
	at com.sun.mail.iap.Response. (Response.java:114)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPResponse. (IMAPResponse.java:60)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol.readResponse(IMAPProtocol.java:390)
	at com.sun.mail.iap.Protocol.command(Protocol.java:354)
	- locked <0x000000005994ebc6> (a com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol.fetch(IMAPProtocol.java:2113)
...
	at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol.peekBody(IMAPProtocol.java:1705)
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.getHeader(IMAPMessage.java:878)
	- locked <0x000000007ace4ecd> (a java.lang.Object)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.getPrecedenceHeader(AbstractMessageHandler.java:1409)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.checkBulk(AbstractMessageHandler.java:473)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.canHandleMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:415)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$1.process(MailFetcherService.java:376)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$MessageProviderImpl.getAndProcessMail(MailFetcherService.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.runImpl(MailFetcherService.java:366)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingService.run(AbstractMessageHandlingService.java:229)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runService(ServiceRunner.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runServiceId(ServiceRunner.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runJob(ServiceRunner.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:443)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:438)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJobWithRecoveryGuard(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:462)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
   Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- None
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Fixes
 * *Implemented* - Separate heartbeat service from shared Caesium service.
 * Process only unread messages?

h3. Workaround
 * If it is blocked/delayed by Mail handler jobs, delete or move the older, previously read messages in the inbox. This accelerates email processing, freeing the Caesium threads more quickly and avoiding the problem.
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center Cache replication stops due to Heartbeat jobs failure

	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.data.DataTagWriter.write(DataTagWriter.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.data.DataTagWriter.write(DataTagWriter.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.assembler.DefaultWebResourceSet.writeHtmlTags(DefaultWebResourceSet.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.assembler.DefaultWebResourceSet.writeHtmlTags(DefaultWebResourceSet.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.assembler.DefaultWebResourceSet.writeHtmlTags(DefaultWebResourceSet.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering.includeResources(HeaderFooterRendering.java:109)
	at jsp.decorators.message_jsp._jspService(message_jsp.java:216)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729)
{code}

h5. Use case scenario

As an Admin, if you notice an error such as the above, you can copy the URL to investigate which page is causing the problem which would then lead to the error being created.

Secondly, if a user is given the link to the attachment because a colleague believes it would be useful to him and he is not yet granted permission to view the issue, the error above would be thrown.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue in JIRA as user A.
# Add an attachment that has a white space to the issue.
# Copy the URL of the attachment.
# In a private browsing mode or a different browser, login to JIRA as user B.
# Paste the URL of the attachment copied in step 3 to a tab in the Browser User B logged in to.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA throws a permission validation error that is easy to understand.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA throws the error above which makes it look like a stream object is failing and can be misleading.
fields.summary: JIRA Throws Misleading Error if a User attempts to Open an attachment they should not be able to view

fields.description:
h3. Definition
The way mail handler works is that the Default Reporter will only be used when the user who sent the email is anonymous. If the user is a JIRA user, the default reporter will be taken over by the JIRA user who sent the email. Thus, it is an expected behaviour that a JIRA user who does not have a permission on the project won't be able to create an issue on that specific project. This is due to the fact that JIRA will check the JIRA user's permission first before proceeding to process the email. Unlike with anonymous users, there's no such checking and just simply proceed to use the default reporter.

h3. Suggestion
It would be better if the mail handler uses the following logic:

1. Is user known in JIRA?
* YES go to step 2
* NO use default reporter

2. Has user access to the project?
* YES set user as reporter
* NO use default reporter
fields.summary: Improve How Mail Handler Checks the User Permission

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a non-admin JIRA user creates or clones a board and flags an issue, there would be a pop-up for a system re-index in JIRA.

Looking at the audit log, you would notice that JIRA would mention that the user triggered a field configuration and that pop-up would mention the same.

This can be confusing for the JIRA Admin as non-admin users should not be able to perform actions that would prompt JIRA to request you to perform a re-index.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create/Copy a board in JIRA Software as a non-JIRA Admin user.
# Flag an issue in the board.
# Go to any admin page and JIRA would prompt you to reindex telling you it is due to the change made.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA does not prompt the Admins to reindex JIRA and performs a re-index silently or we provide more details as to what exactly lead to the prompt to re-index JIRA in the Audit Log page.
fields.summary: Non-Admin User Causes System Reindex Pop-Up

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users are passed links to projects they don't have access to, they receive a "This project isn't available" error screen with a nebulous "may have been deleted or you don't have permission" error. If the "Contact Administrators Form" feature is enabled a user will be able to contact the system admin to request access, but system admins may not be in the best position to evaluate access requests.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to customize this error message with contact details for the *Project Administrator* so the user can reach out to them directly. Alternatively, extend current "Contact Administators" functionality to be context-sensitive and provide an option to contact the project administrator.
h3. Why this is important

Time is lost if a system administrator has to confer with a project administration regarding adding access for a user.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be presented with the contact details for the project admin when I receive a permissions error when accessing a project

h5. Issue Summary

If a user opens an attachment after his session times out, JIRA would show a white page and throw the error below in the logs instead of prompting the user to login.
{code}
2017-04-27 21:51:11,813 http-nio-8734-exec-19 ERROR anonymous 1311x1811x1 - 127.0.0.1 /secure/attachment/10003/test%20efte.docx [c.a.j.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /10003/test efte.docx: Illegal character in path at index 29: /secure/attachment/10003/test efte.docx
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 29: /secure/attachment/10003/test efte.docx
	at java.net.URI.create(URI.java:852)
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.ResolvingServletForwarder.resolve(ResolvingServletForwarder.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.ResolvingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(ResolvingServletForwarder.java:52)
	at

Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 29: /secure/attachment/10003/test efte.docx
	at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2848)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:3021)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parseHierarchical(URI.java:3105)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3063)
	at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:588)
	... 262 more
{code}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Attach a file *which has spaces* in the name e.g. "my image.png" to an issue.
# Open any pages in a new tab.
# Sign out of JIRA in the new tab.
# Go back to the issue in the original tab and open the attached file.

h5. Expected Result

JIRA would prompt the user to login so as to be able to view the attachment.

h5. Actual Result

JIRA would show a blank white page with the error shown above.

h5. Observation and Workaround

The issue has been observed to occur only when there is a space in the name of the file in question.

If there is none, JIRA works correctly and prompts the user to login back.

Hence, remove white spaces between files as a workaround.
fields.summary: Opening an Attachment after Session Timeout Results in Blank page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Webhook is not triggered according to the status it's going to. But it is triggered when getting out from this status

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the webhooks settings
# Create an event to be triggered when the issue is updated and describe a specific status within the JQL (JQL: project = "My Project" and status ="In Progress")
# Create an issue and transition to the status "In Progress"
# Ensure the post-functions to this status (In Progress) have an *issue updated* event

h3. Expected Results
The webhook will be triggered since it entered on the status as the JQL within the WebHook settings

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is not triggered, but if you change the status from *In Progress* to any other one, the webhook is triggered. 
 
h3. Notes 
It seems the webhook is being fired according to the status it's coming from instead of the status it's going to.

h3. Workaround
Since the webhook is triggered based on the status it's coming from and not the current status, you could try the following if you need it to trigger when going to 'In progress', for example:
* Edit your project Workflow, only allow one status to transition to 'In Progress'
* For example, only 'Selected for Development' can move to 'In Progress'
* Set your Webhook JQL to be *project = "My Project" and status ="Selected for Development"*
* When the ticket transitions away from *Select for Development*, it can only go to *In Progress*
* So the POST will be sent only when the issue moves to *In Progress*

As this is a very specific workaround, we understand not everyone might be able to follow it. Another way to do this is to have your application call the [Jira REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/rest-apis/] to check the current status.
fields.summary: Webhook is not triggered correctly when the JQL is describing a specific status.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing bitbucket issues to JIRA using bitbucket importer that is available in JIM the import does not complete if the bitbucket issues have a large attachment.

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.3.3
* Bitbucket cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any 3 bitbucket issue and attach a file with 50+MB file size.
# Perform bitbucket import.
# Stuck at the screen. 

h3. Expected Results
The bitbucket issues are imported successfully to JIRA instance.

h3. Actual Results
The import stocked for a couple of house when it is importing large attachment from bitbucket issues.

h3.Workaround
There are few workarounds:
- Remove any attachments with more than 50 MB file size from bitbucket issues.
- Export bitbucket repository out and import using JSON or convert to CSV (https://www.coolutils.com/online/JSON-to-CSV) and import JIRA using CSV with the exported bitbucket repository from step 1.
(!) They might need to adjust the JSON or CSV format to match our import condition before can import to JIRA.
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud import to JIRA Fails To complete when downloading a large data

fields.description:
h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA default priority from Administration -> Issues -> Priorities and select "Major" as default priority.
# From Administration -> System -> External System Import, select CVS import and import the attached TEST2.CVS file to JIRA.
# In the Wizard File import screen, click advanced and change the delimiter from comma to semicolon.
# Select a project to import to and complete the wizard screens make sure you map the 3 Fields as in the file
# Begin the import
# Check the project that was selected to verify the issues created


h3. Expected Results
Issue should be created in the project picking up default issue priority.

h3. Actual Results
* Issues are created with no priority field initially.
* Once the issue Edit screen is open, JIRA picks up the wrong priority and put it on the issue.
JIRA doesn't use the set default priority, seems it picks first one it finds in priorities table.

 

h3.Workaround
* If the import is just for issues, use the Issues menu CVS import "Bulk Change".
* Provide the priority in the CSV before the External System import handles it, then it will use what is provided in the CSV. needs a script for large import or even need to be done manually which is inconvenient to the customers.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Allow the user to set a default field separator they prefer to use when exporting CSV files and have Jira observe it.

 
h3. Notes
When the CSV file format was developed to represent spreadsheet data, it was done so with the expectation that most spreadsheets would only contain numbers and short text labels, and since numbers would often contain the decimal point (.) but not commas, the comma (,) would be a very good delimiter.

{code:borderStyle=solid}Issue Type,Issue key,Issue id,Summary,Assignee,Reporter,Priority,Status,Resolution,Created,Updated,Due Date,Fix Version/s,Fix Version/s,Custom field (Epic Link)
Bug,TEST-6780,832043,This is a test comment,TEST,jbrouss,Critical,Done,Done,14/Dec/16 2:28 PM,03/Apr/17 1:03 PM,,AAA 2.1,TEST,TEST-6779{code}

This is not always appropriate and it would help if the users had a choice of what delimeter JIRA will use. 


h3.Workaround
When opening CSV files in Excel, it looks for a field separator character in the top of an incoming CSV file. If it's there, that's what it uses. If it isn't there, it uses the system default. This is done using a line such as sep=, or sep=;

Rather than inputting this manually, it would be great if JIRA asks the user prior to the export and appends this to the file. 


Example:
 !sep.png|thumbnail! 

 !fixed.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow an end user to set a default field separator they prefer to use when exporting CSV files and have Jira observe it.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Solution:
Some times, this error could shown up in the UI when JIRA unable to startup:
{code}
"An error occurred performaing JIRA upgrade", "Failed operation: SetOperation[entityName=jira.properties,entityId=1,propertyKey=jira.version,newType=5,newMapper=TypeMapper[handler=StringPropertyHandler,valueEntity=OSPropertyString]]"
{code}
While the error is indeed show up in the logs:
{noformat}
2017-04-24 08:02:20,827 http-bio-443-exec-14 ERROR Andrew.Bell 482x648680x2 15tlc23 10.64.42.14 /rest/issueNav/latest/preferredSearchLayout [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Failed operation: SetOperation[entityName=ApplicationUser,entityId=10100,propertyKey=jira.issues.preferred.layout.key,newType=5,newMapper=TypeMapper[handler=StringPropertyHandler,valueEntity=OSPropertyString]]
com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.PropertyImplementationException: Failed operation: SetOperation[entityName=ApplicationUser,entityId=10100,propertyKey=jira.issues.preferred.layout.key,newType=5,newMapper=TypeMapper[handler=StringPropertyHandler,valueEntity=OSPropertyString]]
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.propEx(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:317)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.retry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:303)
	...cont...
{noformat}
The actual issue was the caused by at the from the continuation of the stack trace above
{noformat}
	...cont...
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.retry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:297)
	... 226 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: The transaction log for database 'CS_JIRASD_PROD' is full due to 'LOG_BACKUP'.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:372)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2988)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2421)
{noformat}

This error appears to be shown when the SQL server does not have anymore space to store or write more data. Giving more space to the server will allow JIRA to startup.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To remove the *Upgrade* tag from the message as there is no upgrade being triggered and give out the full stack trace that could be expanded like an error for *500 Internal Server error*. With that, we could grab and copy the stack trace for the admin or support to check out. In case that it is indeed an error when upgrading, the stack trace is enough for investigation rather than giving out a false message.
fields.summary: Better error message when JIRA is unable to startup due to upgrade problem

fields.description:
h3. Problem

What we noticing is when a repository containing 240+MB file size, it will takes us around 30 minutes to finish download the zip file due to our network is slow. So, if we apply the scenario to user, they will stuck in the exporting bitbucket repository process like below:
{code:java}
Processing repository rey5516/rawdroid-jsp-282129 (100%) - downloading repository export file
{code}
h3. How to Replicate
 # Login to JIRA Server
 # Go to external system import > bitbucket
 # Enter credential and select the project to import
 # Complete the wizard to import the project into JIRA.

h3. Actual Result

User need to wait until the zip file are completely exported or downloaded by JIRA then only allow JIRA to start import the issues. In the process, it doesn't indicate how long user should wait so it feels like we are stuck in the importing page and doesn't do anything.
h3. Expected Result

The expected result should be showing more meaningful process statement or indication in the GUI instead of showing 100% where it doesn't tell user what is happening behind the process when importing a large file size repository.
fields.summary: Bitbucket import GUI doesn't indicate a meaningful indicator when downloading a large data

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When an image is added to an issue via the transition screen, on saving, you would see the error:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (image-2017-04-24-17-57-49-450.png) not found.
{code}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a JIRA project.
# Edit the project workflow adding a screen to a couple of transitions.
# Publish the workflow.
# Create an issue and attempt to perform one of the transitions that has a screen on it.
# Paste an image using {{Cntrl+V}}.
#- This would only work in Visual Mode.
# The image should appear, complete the transition.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show the image that is attached.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would show in the last comment the error we mentioned above.

h5. Cause

When you use {{Cntrl+V}} to paste the image, JIRA does not actually add the attachment to the issue, hence when you save, you get the error you mentioned.

h5. Workaround

To workaround this issue, you need to do the following:

# Modify the screen associated with the transition.
# Add the Attachment field to the screen.

Doing the above should fix the above issue somewhat however read the following information below:

(!) The workaround above would not work if:
# After pasting the attachment in the *view* mode, you switch to *text* view or type any characters into the comment field.
#- Switching back to the view mode would automatically show the error mentioned.
# If when pasting the comment, if there is a validator that fails, unless you paste the attachment again, the error will occur.

The above are 2 of the scenarios we have come across where the workaround would not work. You run into others that we are not aware of.
fields.summary: Attaching an Image to an issue in a Transition screen results in Unable to render embedded object

As a member of a team that uses the JIRA Kanban board, I would like to be able to select issues to release from the "Done" column instead of releasing all when clicking the "Release ..." link.

In my team, we work on one project that spans multiple repositories. Releasing does not usually happen simultaneously for all repositories, but most frequently for one repository at a time. This is at odds with the current consequence of releasing from a JIRA Kanban board.

What we would like to be able to do is, when we click the "Release ..." link, be prompted with a list of all tickets currently in the "Done" column to select from, and for the selected tickets to be included in the release.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The @mentions search does not display the relevant users, however it displays others that are less relevant to the specific search
when a surname is short (i.e. two letters) and there are other users that have those letters somewhere as part of their username.  As the rest API call returns only 10 results sorted by user name it can happen that more relevant results will be filtered out due to sorting them by user name.

For example if I have the following 5 users with last name "Ha" that we can call "set A"

Ha Alex - username: alexha@example.com

Ha Charly -- username: chha@example.com

Ha Daniel -- username: daha@example.com

Ha James -- username: jha@example.com

Ha Keiran -- username: kha@example.com

and also have the following users with "ha" somewhere in the user name, that we can call "set B"

Haff Albert -- username=aahaff@example.com

Hall Adrian -- username=adhal@contractor.example.com

Haang Albert -- username=ahaang@contractor.example.com

Habbs Alex -- username=ahabbs@example.com

Habdd Anton -- username=ahabdd@example.com

Haffman Alex -- username=ahaffman@example.com

Halknar Ariel -- username=ahalknar@example.com

Hams Albert -- username=ahams@example.com

Hanga Alex -- username=ahanga@example.com

Hax Anton -- username=ahax@example.com


when issuing the @mentions as "@ha" the rest api call will return all the users in set B as it is sorted by user name, however for the end user is more relevant to find the users that have "ha" as surname which would appear on the list if the rest api call would return 15 users instead of the hardcoded value of 10.  Then I believe that the algorithm that JIRA has to display the most relevant users would display those with Ha surname first, however we do not reach that point as the result set has only the users that do not have an Ha surname.

Obviously, the more users a customer would have to more likely they will find this problem.


h2. Environment

* JIRA 7.2.6


h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a JIRA 7.2.6 vanilla instance
# Create the users detailed in the example above (both sets A and B)
# Goto Comments in one issue and type @ha, then the user in set "B" will be displayed rather than the users in set "A"

h2. Expected Results

The users that are most relevant to the @mentions search should be displayed


h2. Actual Results

Users that are less relevant to the search are displayed.


h2. Workaround
Changing the user name in a way that will be sorted before others will workaround the issue, however with a big number of users it is not possible to change each one to make it appear as it should.

h2. Additional Comments

I believe the same problem would happen with short names, however for creating this bug only short surnames were tested.
fields.summary: @mentions does not display the expected users and instead it displays less relevant users when a surname is short (i.e. two letters) and there are other users that have those letters somewhere as part of their username

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using bin installer to install JIRA on OpenSUSE with root privilege and user has chosen to run JIRA as a service, after installation JIRA cannot be automatically started.

h3. Environment
* OpenSUSE 42.1 & 42.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using bin installer to install JIRA
# Choose to run JIRA as a service
# After installation is completed restart server
# Use following command line to verify the service status :
{code}
chkconfig --list jira
systemctl status jira
{code}

h3. Expected Results
{{chkconfig --list jira}} should return : {{jira 0:off 1:off 2:off 3:on 4:off 5:on 6:off}}
{{systemctl status jira}} should show that service is up and running :
 !opensuse_active.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
{{chkconfig --list jira}} returns : {{jira 0:off 1:off 2:off 3:off 4:off 5:off 6:off}}
{{systemctl status jira}} shows that service is inactive :
 !opensuse_inactive.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Installer works correctly on CentOS.

h3.Workaround
Manually setup startup service after JIRA is installed.
fields.summary: Auto startup service creation fails when installing JIRA on OpenSUSE

fields.description:
h5. Description
Using the API to add a watcher require the Browse Project permission. If trying to add watchers using an unauthenticated user, then it wont work. On certain scenarios this is undesirable and not recommended, as adding the Browse Projects permission opens up the entire project to the public.

(i) This request is a derivation of JRASERVER-38009.

h5. Suggestion
Watchers can be managed by users without needing to have the Browse Projects permission. This will allow remote scripts to programatically add/remove watchers without being able to get more additional content from projects.
fields.summary: Managing watchers via Rest API should not require Browse Projects permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Administrators are unable to set an empty clone prefix when using an Oracle Database.

h3. Environment

* JIRA Server (tested in 7.2.8 and 7.3.4)
* Oracle 12c

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open JIRA's Advanced Settings
# Edit the Clone prefix, removing the original 'Clone -' and leaving it empty. 

h3. Expected Results

You are able to set an empty value in the field

h3. Actual Results

When you click on update, the value will return to the original 'Clone -'.
 
h3. Notes
Similar to JRASERVER-27664

h3.Workaround

Create or edit the {{jira-config.properties}} located in the _JIRA-HOME_ and add the following value:

{noformat}
jira.clone.prefix=
{noformat}

This will set the value to the clone prefix to empty.
fields.summary: Unable to clear the Clone prefix while using Oracle Database

 # Use Visual mode

fields.description:
Jira sends a mail when someone is mentioned in a ticket.
 The mail gives very little useful information, and forces you to go to the ticket to be able to understand the context.
 It basically shows ticket number and the added comment.
 It would help a lot if, besides the ticket number, also the ticket summary is included in the mail to give at least some context.
 Most developers recognize the tickets summaries, and know which are important, but they do not recognize the ticket numbers.

We submitted this because we would rather not update the default mail template. As with all customizations it would be another step to take when we upgrade from one JIRA version to another.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is clearly stated in the [Working with Epics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/working-with-epics-861254516.html] documentation:

"The functions for managing epics require different permissions. For example, you need the 'Edit Issues' permission to add an issue to an epic." 

That being said, an epic still shows as an option(in the Epic Link dropbox) for a non-Admin user who has no permission to edit the epic.

Users become confused about what they have actually achieved when they see an epic that looks like a viable option in the dropbox, and when they receive a message claiming that their changes were accepted.  After completing the steps below, the story is not linked to the epic.
h3. Environment

Tested against 7.3.4 and 6.4.14(customer's version)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic in a project and set the permission scheme to only allow Administrators to 'Edit Issues'
 # Create a story in a different project where non-admin user has 'Edit Issues' permission
 # Add the story to the epic by clicking the Edit button and selecting the epic from Step 1 in the Epic Link dropbox

h3. Expected Results

The epic should not show up as an option in the Epic Link dropbox, and/or the user should not receive an '<ISSUE-KEY> has been updated' pop-up. 
h3. Actual Results

Pop-up appears and states '<ISSUE-KEY> has been updated', however the link to the epic does not occur.

 
h3. Workaround

Have an Admin user add the story to the epic.  Granting the non-Admin users Edit Issues permission in the project containing the epic is not an option.
fields.summary: Adding a story to an epic without Edit permissions to epic fails, but claims to work

fields.description: The JIRA search/filter function does not allow the use of a wild card as the first character. Suggest allowing wild cards in any place of the search term.
fields.summary: Custom field search with wild card as first character

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After recent changes to the Atlassian support site, tickets are no longer getting created when user submit them via support tools.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance of JIRA
# Enable outgoing mail and make sure this works
# Go to 'gg' Support Tools --> Get Help --> Create a test issue

h3. Expected Results
Support ticket is created

h3. Actual Results
According to the logs the email is sent properly, but no support ticket is created.
 
h3. Notes
This is an issue with getsupport.atlassian.com, but affects JIRA users directly so I have created this ticket so they can track the resolution of the issue.

h3.Workaround
Create a ticket directly by using http://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Tickets not created when using Create Support Request in support tools after support site update

fields.description:
In JIRA 7.2.8, the login decorator was updated to implement a responsive design. Affected pages include any page that handles a user's authentication details -- i.e., the login page, signup page, logged out page, confirm logout page, and the websudo authentication page.

As part of this design update, the rendering of modal or floating components were changed these pages. This includes AUI Dialog and AUI Flag components.

Whereas dialogs were changed to fill the whole page, flag components were hidden entirely.

This bug repot is here to flag that flags don't appear at any resolution on these authentication-related pages. Some plugins to JIRA may be expect that flags do appear on these pages.
fields.summary: AUI flags do not appear on the websudo page or other authentication pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# The activity stream entries from FishEye are not using the similar date/time formats Yesterday
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  
# Here, we can see JIRA showing only "Yesterday" but the FishEye stream entries are using its own "Yesterday at 15:19" format.

h3. Environment
Tested on:
* JIRA 7.3.2
* FishEye 4.2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Applink JIRA and FishEye. 
# Create an issue in JIRA
# Execute a commit to FishEye

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When checking a Confluence task from the JIRA Dashboard, it will display an error:
{code:java}
 401Client must be authenticated to access this resource. 
{code}
!image-2017-04-19-20-23-10-376.png|width=266,height=143!
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * JIRA and Confluence should be application linked together using OAuth with or without impersonations. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a JIRA and Confluence instance that are linked to each other with "Application Links" -> Oath with impersonation
 # Create some Confluence tasks that are assigned to you with the
 # Create an overview of these tasks by creating a new confluence page and adding the macro "Task Report" (Called "My task overview" for reference here). Configure this report to only show tasks that are assigned to you. Note that this report displays the correct issues
 # Create a JIRA dashboard and add the gadget "Confluence Page Gadget" . Try to add the space where you created the "My task overview" page -> a screen pops up (login and approve) to ask for permission to create the linking (Oath Acces token). After that search and find and add the space and page "My Task overview"
 # The gadget loads -> the tasks are displayed like they are on the Confluence page
 !image-2017-04-19-20-35-25-843.png|width=251,height=109!
 # Try to check a task for completion -> an error appears "401Client must be authenticated to access this resource." with a progress bar that keeps loading

h3. Expected Results

The task should be checked off
h3. Actual Results
 # An error appears "401Client must be authenticated to access this resource" with a progress bar that keeps loading
 # Refresh the JIRA dashboard page -> the gadget shows the confluence page as before, no tasks are checked off.

!image-2017-04-19-20-25-27-441.png|width=266,height=143!
 
h3. Notes

The console shows the following reponse:
{code:java}
 throw 1; < don't be evil' >\{"http://localhost:8092/rest/inlinetasks/1/task/2850818/7/?cacheBuster=1492604819757":\{"rc":401,"headers":\{"x-seraph-trusted-app-status":["ERROR"]},"body":"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" standalone=\"yes\"?><status><status-code>401<\/status-code><message>Client must be authenticated to access this resource.<\/message><\/status>"}} 
{code}

h3. Workaround
Check the tasks directly on Confluence
fields.summary: 401Client must be authenticated to access this resource error when checking Confluence Task on JIRA Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user is granted a permission through *Single user* then:
* If the user has _never_ been renamed, its Display Name is shown in the Permission Scheme for that permission
* If the user has been *renamed*, its current username is shown in the Permission Scheme for that permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in Internal directory with username as *test-user* and Display Name (fullname) as *Test User*
# Edit a Permission Scheme -> grant this user a permission through *Single user* option
(+) Notice that *Test User* is displayed
# Rename _test-user_ to *test-user1*

h3. Expected Behavior
The Permission Scheme still displays _Test User_

h3. Actual Behavior
The Permission Scheme now displays *test-user1*

h3. Notes
This bug may lead to a more visually problematic bug as described in JRASERVER-69472 if a user's current username is the same as another user's old username
fields.summary: Permission Scheme shows username instead of Display Name if user has been renamed before

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If JIRA is set to use the following date picker format and user enter the invalid date, JIRA creates issue with broken state and Indexing error will thrown. The date format which can be used to replicate this problem is:
{code:java}
jira.date.picker.java.format=dd.MM.yyyy
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%Y
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%Y %H:%M
{code}
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a custom field "Date Picker" type and associate it with any create issue screen.
 # Set the date picker format to the format provided above.
 # Create any issue and in the Date Picker field, enter value like "19.04.17" instead of "19.04.2017".
 # Following error will be shown:
{code:java}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.{code}

 # Open System -> Support Tools -> Instance Health and we'll see Indexing related problem highlighted.
 # Problem can only be replicated in MS SQL based instance

 
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.2 & JIRA 7.3.4
h3. Expected Results

JIRA rejects the issue creation because of the invalid date format.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA created an issue in broken state. Checking from database using the following query will show the issue created without any status:
{code:java}
SELECT jiraissue.id issue_id, jiraissue.workflow_id, os_wfentry.*  FROM jiraissue JOIN os_wfentry ON jiraissue.workflow_id = os_wfentry.id
WHERE jiraissue.issuenum = <issue-number> AND (os_wfentry.state IS NULL OR os_wfentry.state = 0);
{code}
h3. Workaround

Using different date picker format could help with this problem. Tested with default date picker format provided in JIRA (d/MMM/yy) and the issue not reproducible.
fields.summary: Date format breaks issue creation

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When creating a Support zip in JIRA, the support zip is created, but an ERROR is thrown in both the logs and the Admin User Interface: 
Your support zip was created, but please note:

    Error processing 'Healthcheck results': NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/support/healthcheck/impl/SupportHealthCheckManager

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Instance Health 2.5
# Generate a support zip

h4. Expected Results

The zip generates without error.

h4. Actual Results

The zip generates with the below error:

{noformat}
[support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask] zip Error processing 'Healthcheck results': NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.SupportHealthCheckManager.performChecks(Lcom/atlassian/support/healthcheck/api/model/HealthCheckFilter;)Ljava/util/List;
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.SupportHealthCheckManager.performChecks(Lcom/atlassian/support/healthcheck/api/model/HealthCheckFilter;)Ljava/util/List;
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.bundle.HealthcheckResultsBundle.getHealthcheckResults(HealthcheckResultsBundle.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.bundle.HealthcheckResultsBundle.getFiles(HealthcheckResultsBundle.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.zip(CreateSupportZipTask.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.createSupportZip(CreateSupportZipTask.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask$1.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask$1.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.support.tools.request.CreateSupportZipTask.call(CreateSupportZipTask.java:26)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)

{noformat}

Update to JIRA Instance Health 2.5.1.

fields.description:
*Environment*
Tested with JIRA 7.3.4 and Github

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
1. Set jira.projectkey.pattern attribute to allow single letters "([A-Z][A-Z0-9]*)"
2. Create DVCS link to account. (tested with Github)
3. Create a project with a single letter key. ex. "A" 
4. Create an issue. ex. A-1
5. Make a commit to a repo that mentions issue A-1

 

*Expected Results*
Development panel would appear when viewing issue.

 

*Actual Results*
Development panel does not appear.


*Workaround*
Use a project key with more than one letter.
fields.summary: Development panel is not visible on issues created under single letter project keys

fields.description:
Hello!

It would be really helpful if there was a way to flag/star important comments in issues. 

Something like Testing Steps or specific Release Notes are put into comments and then get lost in the myriad of collapsed comments.  

Here is my simple recommendation for both the action and how it would be displayed.  It would just consist of toggling on/off the "Important" flag for a comment.  Then the flagged items would be listed with the dates and a truncated snippet of the content would link down to the anchored/flagged comment.

*Starring or Flagging comments:*

!Hydra_Important_Comments_Adding.png|width=639,height=453!

*Where the Flagged comments would appear (or in the right column?):*

!Hydra_Important_Comments.png|width=754,height=475!

 

This could be a really useful feature for a wide range of users and teams.  

 

Thank you,

Summer
fields.summary: Flag/star Important Comments in Issues, otherwise they get lost in collapsed comments sections

fields.description:
h3. JIRA Activity Stream uses relative URL for .pdf attachments in Confluence
h3. Environment

JIRA Software 7.3.3
 Confluence 6.0.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have JIRA installed with a base URL of jira.domain.com
 # Have Confluence installed and running with a base URL of confluence.domain.com
 # Create reciprocal applinks between the two applications
 # Have a JIRA dashboard with an Activity Stream gadget streaming Confluence activity
 # Create a new Confluence page
 # Attach a .pdf file to the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
 * .pdf preview appears in JIRA Activity Stream
 * Clicking the .pdf preview opens the file on confluence.domain.com

h3. Actual Results
 * .pdf preview does not appear
 * Clicking the .pdf preview throws a 404
 * The URL to the .pdf within the activity stream is jira.domain.com

h3. Workaround

None.
h3. Notes

Other attachments (.docx, .png, .jpg) appear as expected.
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream uses relative URL for .pdf attachments in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As such it requires multiple watches and unwatches to get an issue unwatched; and can be very confusing. B

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Autowatch reported issues (the default is set to Yes)
# Create an issue, and remove yourself as the watcher.
#* Note that the More menu item for watching is currently set to Watch Issue
#* The sidebar Watchers field says Start watching this issue
# Transition the issue, using a transition that has a screen and the comment field.

Then, do one of the following:
# Click Stop Watching this Issue
# Click the number of watchers, then trash your own username

h3. Expected Results
# The More menu item for watching is currently set to Stop watching
# The sidebar Watchers field says Stop watching this issue
# The lozenge for the watchers is grey (because you are not watching the issue)

h3. Actual Results
# The More menu item for watching is currently set to Watch issue
# The sidebar Watchers field says Stop watching this issue
# The lozenge is the same colour as if you were watching the issue still
 
h3. Notes
* It looks like there are two seperate rest endpoints being used:
** Used when removing self from the Watchers field via the lozenge: {{rest/api/2/issue/REP-2/watchers?username=<username>}}
** Used when removing self via the Stop Watching this issue link: {{rest/api/1.0/issues/10101/watchers}}

Both requests return successfully (i.e, a 204 via the lozenge, and a 200 via the Stop watching this issue via the link). There was also some discussions about permissions being relevant, but it's tough to determine how relevant those permissions are.

(i) If you can reliably reproduce this behaviour where permissions for users are a factor, please reply in the comments section below.

Additionally, in some circumstances, the Watch Issue link is out life line with the rest of the menu, and doesn't behave like a menu item (but it can be clicked regardless).

h3. Workaround One:
* Click Stop Watching this issue on the sidebar (alternatively, you can click More » Watch Issue
* Click More » Watch issue
* Click Stop Watching this issue - the issue should now unwatch correctly.

h3.Workaround Two:
Using bulk tools, watch and then unwatch the issues (two seperate bulk issues). You can use {{key in watchedIssues()}} as a starting point to find all issues you're currently watching.

h3.Workaround Three:
Disable Autowatch on own issues. By default, users inherit from [the global user settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-user-default-settings-938847012.html].
fields.summary: In certain circumstances, the Stop Watching functionality does not work correctly when unwatching issues reported by you while Autowatch is enabled.
